column2: Night settled gently over the countryside.
The sky darkened to deep indigo.
Stars began to appear one by one.
I stepped outside for a moment.
The scent of grass lingered softly.
A faint owl hoot echoed nearby.
She joined me on the doorstep.
The moon glowed above the horizon.
A soft yawn escaped my lips.
It had been a long day.
A lamp cast a gentle glow.
The spoon clinked against the pot.
Two bowls were placed on the table.
She carried a basket of bread.
We moved to the sitting room.
An old film flickered on the screen.
A blanket rested across our laps.
Only the film filled the space.
She slid under the covers too.
A faint glow touched the curtains.
I sat on the edge of the bed.
The mirror reflected a calm face.
The familiar scent of tea awaited.
Fruit and cereal filled the bowl.
I admired their beauty once more.
A final glance around the house.
The journey was ready to begin.
